Last minute requests welcome! Dates are very flexible, I'll plan to stay with friends during your stay (I'm saving up for a trip of my own). Pictures upon request.

Stay in my cozy Times Square apt and have your own room (with two beds) for a lot less than a hotel, and less than most hostels, too. My apartment is 3 blocks from nearly every subway line imaginable, Penn Station, Port Authority Bus Terminal, and right on 9th Ave where you can find great bars, pubs, and restaurants. Dangerously close to 5th Avenue and Fashion Avenue shopping, and 20 minutes from the Lower East Side and Soho for going out at night. Great deal especially if you're coming with a friend or two since you can split the price, although for a solo traveler it still beats a hotel and affords more privacy and safety than a hostel. Fully equipped kitchen as well (eating out all the time can get really expensive in New York)! Because of the 9th Avenue and rear location of the apartment you won't have any problems with noise should you plan to get some sleep. Get excellent mojitos at the (quiet) bar/restaurant next door, keep up with your piano practice on my Bergmann upright piano (but be respectful of my neighbors!) I'll provide fresh linens and towels.

Respond with your name, gender, age, profession, and where you are coming from and I'll get back to you ASAP. I can provide references if necessary, and I'm a student at NYU so I'm easily google-able if you want to check up on who I am.

item.title: Condo Seasonal Ski Rental Share (Mount Snow)
item.description:
Looking for people to share rental cost of spacious, upscale, fabulously furnished 5 BR/ 4 Bath, 3 level Mount Snow condo

Buy 3 or 6 weekends:

6 weekends - $1000 pp (Price for couple sharing room w queen bed/ $1900)
Dates: December 16-18 plus you pick ANY 5 of the following PRIME skiing weekends:
Jan 6-8, Jan 20-22, Jan 27-29, Feb 3 - 5, Feb 24-26, Mar 2-4, Mar 16-18 (we are pretty flexible with switches after season starts if there is availability)

3 weekends $550 pp (for those with commitment issues-we totally understand)
Dates: Pick either A or B PRIME weekend schedule: A) Jan 6-8, Feb 3-5, Mar 2-4 or B) Jan 20-22, Feb 24-26, Mar 16-18

Share price includes: one bed in a two bedded room, utilities, towels/linens, monthly cleaning and basic staples like TP, paper towels and soap. No extra charges/no requirement to pay for a "food plan" of any sort.

About the Condo
• 2 minutes (not even) from the mountain -- MOOVer stop (shuttle to mountain) at our doorstep.
• Max 2 people per bedroom! No bunk beds (unless you really want them :-) ).
• Totally un-crowded - we try and keep it to a max of 8 people per weekend to keep things civilized.
• Two living rooms -- one on main floor and a second on lower level -- both with TVs and comfy sectional sofas.
• Views of the mountain from the condo
• Fantastic, brick face, wood burning fireplace with plenty of wood outside the front door.
• Locked ski equipment closet on front porch
• Next door to cross country / snow shoe trail system
• Gym (treadmills, elliptical, weights) and indoor pool / jacuzzi at the complex clubhouse
• Plenty of (well plowed) parking

•Sorry -- No pets. No smoking in the house (outside is fine by us -- we don't judge!)
About Us:
• Early and late risers. Mostly skiers, one or two boarders and lame cross country skiers
• From NYC, Long Island and Westchester
• 40s -- 50s, girls/guys - but don't really care how old you are.
• Not hard partiers but almost always head to happy hour at the base lodge (Sometimes to the Hermitage Inn for White Russians).
• Generally out for dinner on Saturday as a group - Two Tannery and Last Chair (aka Deacon's) - sometimes Snowbarn pizza
• We'd also be totally open to group dinners at home if we could recruit a share that is a good cook!
• Absolutely no requirement to hang with us if you don't want to.

If you are interested -- send me an email, tell me a little about yourself and what you are looking for.
Cheers
Lisa

item.title: Best Location in Manhattan (Upper East Side) 3bd
item.description:
Built in the late 19th Century, this charming five story house with pedimented windows and high ceilings is filled with light and warmth.
Manhattan's Upper East Side is a glittering neighborhood of townhouses, brownstones, luxurious apartments, famous stores and shops, art galleries and Michelin-starred restaurants. East 62nd Street between Lexington and Park Avenues is a residential, tree-lined street, set apart from the Manhattan bustle, but accessible to Times Square, Columbus Circle, and Grand Central Station via a brisk walk. The townhouse is within walking distance of Central park, major New York Museums and galleries, and such stores as Bloomingdales, Bergdorf Goodman's, and Tiffany's. A short crosstown ride take you to Lincoln Center, home of ballet, opera, theater, and symphonic and other concerts. All the sparkle of the city, the delights of the Broadway state, the museums, the midtown offices, the schools and universities, are within easy reach of this wonderfully well located townhouse. item.title: Private Room in 2-Bedroom Condo (Manhattan) $88 1bd 900sqft
item.description:
Times are tough, and we know how to turn lemons into Mike's Hard Lemonade. Also, before you read any further, rest assured that this is not a scam. We do not accept deposits from anyone - never have, never will. Even if you choose not to stay here, do yourself a favor and avoid anyone who wants a deposit; you won't have a place to stay when you arrive and you'll never see your hard-earned cash again. Consider this a public service message from two guys who are just tryin' to keep 'em honest. We think Anderson would be proud.

Now, back to your regularly scheduled vacation...

We have a beautiful and spacious fourth-floor 2-bedroom condo in Harlem, one room in which we rent out on a nightly basis to responsible, mature adults who want a gorgeous place to stay while visiting Manhattan but think that paying $350 a night for a shoddy hotel is insane.

We're non-discriminating kind of people - we don't care what you look like - but we do expect you to be polite, clean and easygoing. We'd also prefer it if you didn't steal our stuff.

One thing you should know - we're a young, professional gay couple (both 29 years old). Not that that has any bearing on your stay with us, but we'd hate to have to turn someone away for being a bigot. If you're open-minded enough to accept that gays, in fact, do exist, then get in touch.

Also, we doting parents to two little dogs named Jaxon and Luxe. They're super fun and lovable - and they'll expect you to treat them the same.

During your stay you can enjoy an air-conditioned/heated private room; fresh (and super soft) Ralph Lauren towels; access to our in-unit washer/dryer (no charge); flat-screen LCD/LED TVs; board games and DVDs; FREE Wi-Fi; an in-room mini fridge and coffee service; and all the cereal you can eat (until we run out). Hey, this ain't a restaurant.

We have a Wii that you can play, too. But we'll warn you - you might get schooled in Mario Kart and Trivial Pursuit. Just sayin'.

Our condo is just around the corner from the 2/3 express subway train and a 3-minute walk to B/C local trains. We're just minutes away from Yankee Stadium and Columbia University, and you can be in Times Square in 15 minutes by subway. The apartment is easy to get to by subway from Grand Central, Penn Station and Port Authority. A cab ride from LaGuardia is relatively inexpensive (about $15 pp), but the bus is even cheaper ($2.25).

P.S. We will be home during your stay. This will be a shared-space situation. But a fun, inexpensive one nonetheless. We've already met some pretty fantastic people from all over the world, so the bar is high. Don't bring it down.

Testimonials:

We had a great time in New York which was made possible by staying with [the hosts] in their nice, awesome apartment in Morningside near Harlem. Both the bedroom and washroom are clean and immaculate. The apartment is cozy and gives you a bonus feel and experience of what everyday living in New York is like. Great location with express subway to downtown and a direct bus to LaGuardia close by. [They] are great hosts. Easy-going and friendly. Definitely next time we visit we will give them a shout. A definite recommend for those of you looking for a more real New York experience."

-Donald and Hannah, Vancouver, B.C.

"My friend Jeremy and I recently stayed for two nights and loved every second of it. I have to compliment our hosts for a thoroughly enjoyable experience. I found the room very warm and welcoming. I would extremely recommend this and I would certainly stay again!!!"

-Daryl, 20, San Francisco

"Thanks for letting us stay at your place. You guys were great... can't find two nicer guys in all of New York. The apartment was SPOTLESS... and very well decorated. Considering that hotels are around $350 a night this was a killer deal! We paid less for three nights than it would have cost for one night in a hotel. There was a washer and dryer... lots of towels, a comfortable bed and the subway is only a few blocks away. The neighborhood was nice and peaceful. Next time we go to New York you guys are the first ones we call! Thanks guys!!"

-Ivan, 25, South Dakota

"It was great staying with you guys; you made me feel so welcome and your place was just fabulous. I had no idea what to expect, as Craiglist's can be daunting, but your place was extremely clean, modern and spacious. The apartment is in a great uptown location, near a subway that can get you to Times Square in 15 minutes, and is also close to all the Central Park Museums and Galleries (D Train- faster and cheaper than a NY cab). I was not able to find a decent hotel in NY for love or money and via Craiglists List I found not just a great place to stay but also gained two life long friends who I will definitely stay in contact with."

-Mark, 25, London

"I was very glad I decided to stay in this cozy apartment in Harlem. It was my first time responding to an ad on Craigslist, and I really didn't know what to expect. Both of you were so welcoming & friendly and the room was very comfortable. It certainly beats staying in a $250-$500/night room in the heart of Manhattan. I was even able to use the washer/dryer when my luggage had not shown up the second day I was there. Will definitely look you up when my travel plans take me to NYC again."

-Mike, Bermuda
